title: Legal Notice

analysis.plainSummary: This contract is a legal notice from the Nashik Municipal Corporation regarding an illegal shop ("Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center") operating on public land without permission. The recipient is ordered to remove the structure within seven days, restore the area, and submit a compliance report. Failure to comply will result in the city demolishing the shop at the recipient's expense, along with potential criminal charges. This notice serves as a final warning before further legal action is taken by the court. The recipient faces significant risks including business closure, financial penalties, and legal repercussions if they do not comply immediately.

clauses.title: Notice for Removal of Unauthorized Structure
clauses.originalText: you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you.
clauses.simplifiedText: This is a legal notice because you are running an illegal shop on public land without permission. The city and the court have noticed that you built and are running an unauthorized stall called “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center” on Main Road, Shivaji Nagar, which is causing problems for the public and breaking city rules. People have complained about your shop blocking the street. The city checked and found that the shop is illegal. You were warned before, but you did not fix the problem.
clauses.explanation: This clause outlines the core issue: the recipient is operating an illegal structure on public land, which is a violation of municipal regulations.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is accused of operating an illegal structure, potentially impacting their business operations.

clauses.title: Directive to Remove Structure
clauses.originalText: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.
clauses.simplifiedText: You must remove the illegal shop and leave the public land within 7 days of getting this notice. You also need to fix the area to how it was before and not build anything illegal there again. You must send a written report to the city's legal office to confirm you have done these things.
clauses.explanation: This clause details the specific actions the recipient must take to rectify the violation, including a strict deadline.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is required to dismantle their business structure and restore the land, potentially halting business operations.
risks: Costs associated with demolition and restoration

clauses.title: Consequences of Non-Compliance
clauses.originalText: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you.
clauses.simplifiedText: If you don't follow this notice in time, the city will tear down the illegal shop without telling you again. You will have to pay for the demolition and any legal costs. You might also face criminal charges under the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act.
clauses.explanation: This clause outlines the severe consequences of failing to comply with the notice, including demolition, financial penalties, and criminal charges.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner faces significant financial and legal repercussions for non-compliance.
risks: Financial burden of demolition costs and legal expenses

clauses.title: Final Intimation
clauses.originalText: This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action.
clauses.simplifiedText: This notice is the last warning before the court takes legal action.
clauses.explanation: This clause emphasizes the urgency and finality of the notice, indicating that legal action is imminent if the recipient does not comply.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is on notice that further legal action is impending.

risks.description: Operating an illegal shop/structure on public land without proper municipal permission.
risks.recommendation: Immediately cease operations and consult with legal counsel to understand the implications and potential defenses.

risks.description: Failure to remove the illegal structure and restore the encroached area within the stipulated timeframe.
risks.recommendation: Prioritize the removal of the structure and restoration of the area within the 7-day deadline. Document all actions taken to demonstrate compliance.

risks.description: Facing demolition of the illegal structure, financial penalties, and potential criminal proceedings due to non-compliance.
risks.recommendation: Take immediate action to comply with the notice and seek legal representation to mitigate potential penalties and defend against criminal charges.

actionPoints: Immediately cease operations of the unauthorized stall.
Consult with legal counsel to understand the implications of the notice and potential defenses.
Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public land within 7 days of receiving the notice.
Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik, within the 7-day timeframe.

citations.title: The Maharashtra Municipal Corporations Act, 1949
citations.description: Provides the legal framework for municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including powers related to encroachment removal and public land management. (Note: This is a GR related to amendment, finding the original act online is difficult)

citations.title: The Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014

originalContent:
Before the Hon’ble Court of Civil Judge, Nashik (Civil Jurisdiction) Court Notice No.: CJ/NK/ILG/2025/1784 Date of Issue:   17th October 2025 To, Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil Shop Owner (Unauthorized Stall) Plot No. 112/B, Near Shivaji Nagar Main Road, Ward No. 07, Nashik   –   422009, Maharashtra. Subject:   Legal Notice for Remova l of Unauthorized Commercial Structure and Encroachment on Public Street. Sir/Madam, Under the instructions and authority vested in me by   The Hon’ble Civil Court, Nashik , and in accordance with the provisions of   The Maha rashtra Municipal Corporations Act, 1949 , The Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014 , and other applicable municipal regulations, you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you. You are hereby directed as follows: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.

Failure to Comply: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you. This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action. Issued By: (Signed) Adv. Meena R. Jadhav Standing Counsel, Nashik Municipal Corporation Enrollment No.: MAH/ADV/2020/4512 Chamber No. 12, Civil Court Complex, Nashik   –   422002 Contact: +91 - 98211 - 00089 | Email:   legalcell@nashikmc.gov.in

visuals.textSummary: Legal notice issued by the Nashik Municipal Corporation, through Adv. Meena R. Jadhav, to Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil for operating an unauthorized commercial stall on public land. The notice demands removal of the structure within 7 days, restoration of the area, and submission of a compliance report. Failure to comply will result in demolition at Mr. Patil's expense and potential criminal proceedings.

nodes.label: Remove Illegal Structure and Restore Area

items.partyA: If Mr. Patil fails to comply, remove/demolish the structure.
items.partyB: Remove the illegal structure within 7 days.
items.relatedClause: 1. Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice.

items.partyA: Ensure the area is restored if Mr. Patil fails to do so.
items.partyB: Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
items.relatedClause: 2. Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation.

items.partyA: Receive and review the compliance report.
items.partyB: Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell within 7 days.
items.relatedClause: 3. Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.

items.partyA: Recover all costs incurred in demolition, including legal expenses.
items.partyB: Be liable for all costs incurred in the demolition if non-compliant.
items.relatedClause: all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue

title: Legal Notice

analysis.plainSummary: This notice informs you that your "Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center" is an illegal structure on public land. You must remove the shop and restore the area within seven days of receiving this notice. Failure to comply will result in the city demolishing the structure at your expense, potentially including legal fees. Furthermore, you could face criminal charges. This is a final warning before legal action is taken.

clauses.title: Notice for Removal of Unauthorized Structure
clauses.originalText: you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you.
clauses.simplifiedText: You are being notified to remove your illegal shop because it's on public land without permission. The city and court know about it, and it's causing problems for people and breaking rules. People have complained, and an inspection confirmed it's illegal. You've been warned before, but you haven't done anything about it.
clauses.explanation: This clause outlines the core issue: the operation of an illegal structure on public land without permission, leading to public inconvenience and violation of municipal norms.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is accused of operating an illegal business on public land.
obligations: Cease operation of the illegal business.
risks: Legal action by the Municipal Corporation.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: N/A - This is not a landlord-tenant situation.

clauses.title: Directive to Remove Structure and Restore Area
clauses.originalText: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.
clauses.simplifiedText: You must remove the illegal shop from the public land within 7 days of getting this notice. You also need to fix the area back to how it was and not use the land without permission again. You must send a report to the Municipal Legal Cell confirming you've done this.
clauses.explanation: This clause provides specific instructions for rectifying the violation, including a deadline for compliance and a requirement to submit a compliance report.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is being ordered to take specific actions to rectify the illegal use of public land.
obligations: Remove the illegal structure within 7 days.
Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
risks: Failure to comply will result in further legal action and demolition.
Incurring costs associated with removal and restoration.

clauses.title: Consequences of Non-Compliance
clauses.originalText: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you.
clauses.simplifiedText: If you don't follow this notice in time, the city will remove the shop without telling you again. You will have to pay for the removal, including legal fees. You might also face criminal charges.
clauses.explanation: This clause outlines the severe consequences of failing to comply with the notice, including demolition, financial penalties, and potential criminal charges.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner faces significant penalties for non-compliance.
risks: Financial liability for demolition costs and legal expenses.

clauses.title: Final Intimation
clauses.originalText: This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action.
clauses.simplifiedText: This notice is the last warning before the court takes legal action.
clauses.explanation: This clause emphasizes the seriousness of the notice and its role as a final warning before further legal action is taken.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: The business owner is being given a final opportunity to comply before legal action is taken.
obligations: Comply with the notice immediately to avoid legal action.
risks: Imminent legal action if the notice is not complied with.

risks.description: Operating an illegal shop/structure on public land without proper municipal permission.
risks.recommendation: Immediately cease operations and seek legal counsel to understand the implications and potential remedies.

risks.description: Failure to remove the illegal structure and restore the area within the stipulated timeframe.
risks.recommendation: Comply with the notice immediately to avoid further legal action and financial penalties.

risks.description: Risk of demolition of the illegal structure by the Municipal Corporation.
risks.recommendation: Take immediate action to remove the structure to avoid demolition and associated costs.

risks.description: Risk of incurring demolition costs and legal expenses.
risks.recommendation: Comply with the notice to avoid incurring these expenses.

risks.description: Risk of criminal proceedings under the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 1966.
risks.recommendation: Seek legal counsel immediately to understand the potential criminal charges and develop a defense strategy.

actionPoints: Immediately cease operation of the unauthorized stall.
Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public land within 7 days of receiving the notice.
Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik, within the specified timeframe.
Seek legal counsel to understand the full implications of the notice and potential legal recourse.

Before the Hon’ble Court of Civil Judge, Nashik (Civil Jurisdiction) Court Notice No.: CJ/NK/ILG/2025/1784 Date of Issue:   17th October 2025 To, Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil Shop Owner (Unauthorized Stall) Plot No. 112/B, Near Shivaji Nagar Main Road, Ward No. 07, Nashik   –   422009, Maharashtra. Subject:   Legal Notice for Remova l of Unauthorized Commercial Structure and Encroachment on Public Street. Sir/Madam, Under the instructions and authority vested in me by   The Hon’ble Civil Court, Nashik , and in accordance with the provisions of   The Maha rashtra Municipal Corporations Act, 1949 , The Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014 , and other applicable municipal regulations, you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you. You are hereby directed as follows: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.

Failure to Comply: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you. This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action. Issued By: (Signed) Adv. Meena R. Jadhav Standing Counsel, Nashik Municipal Corporation Enrollment No.: MAH/ADV/2020/4512 Chamber No. 12, Civil Court Complex, Nashik   –   422002 Contact: +91 - 98211 - 00089 | Email:   legalcell@nashikmc.gov.in

notice immediately to avoid further legal action and financial penalties."},{"id":"3","clause":"3","description":"Risk of demolition of the illegal structure by the Municipal Corporation.","severity":"high","recommendation":"Take immediate action to remove the structure to avoid demolition and associated costs."},{"id":"4","clause":"3","description":"Risk of incurring demolition costs and legal expenses.","severity":"high","recommendation":"Comply with the notice to avoid incurring these expenses."},{"id":"5","clause":"3","description":"Risk of criminal proceedings under the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 1966.","severity":"high","recommendation":"Seek legal counsel immediately to understand the potential criminal charges and develop a defense strategy."}],"actionPoints":["Immediately cease operation of the unauthorized stall.","Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public land within 7 days of receiving the notice.","Restore 1949","url":"https://maharashtra.gov.in/site/upload/government%20resolutions/Marathi/201803051727160407.pdf","description":"This"}]}

visuals.textSummary: A legal notice issued by the Nashik Municipal Corporation, under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik, to Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil, demanding the removal of an unauthorized commercial structure and encroachment on a public street within 7 days. Failure to comply will result in demolition of the structure, recovery of costs, and potential criminal proceedings.

nodes.label: Remove Illegal Structure and Vacate Land
Structure Removed, Area Restored, Report Submitted

responsibilities.label: Responsibilities for Removal of Unauthorized Structure

items.partyA: Demolish structure if not removed by Mr. Patil.
items.partyB: Remove the illegal structure within 7 days.

items.partyA: Ensure restoration if Mr. Patil fails to do so.
items.partyB: Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell.

items.partyA: Recover demolition costs from Mr. Patil if non-compliant.
items.partyB: Responsible for costs incurred by the Municipal Corporation for demolition if non-compliant.
Potentially face criminal proceedings for non-compliance.

title: Legal Notice

analysis.plainSummary: This notice informs you that your "Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center" is an illegal structure on public land. You have seven days to remove the stall, restore the area, and report to the city. Failure to comply will result in the city demolishing the structure at your expense. You will also face criminal charges and further legal action. This is the final warning before the court intervenes.

clauses.title: Notice for Removal of Unauthorized Structure
clauses.originalText: you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you.
clauses.simplifiedText: You are being notified to remove your illegal shop because it's on public land without permission. People have complained, and the city has confirmed it's illegal. You've been warned before, but you haven't done anything about it.
clauses.explanation: This clause informs the recipient of the legal action being taken against them for operating an illegal structure on public land. It highlights the violations and the lack of compliance with previous warnings.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: As the recipient, this clause directly impacts your business operations, requiring you to cease operations and remove the structure.

clauses.title: Directive to Remove Structure and Restore Area
clauses.originalText: You are hereby directed as follows: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.
clauses.simplifiedText: You must remove the illegal structure within 7 days, fix the area back to how it was, and send a report to the city.
clauses.explanation: This clause outlines the specific actions the recipient must take, including removing the structure, restoring the area, and submitting a compliance report. It sets a clear deadline for compliance.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: This clause mandates specific actions that directly affect your business, including cessation of operations and physical removal of the structure.
risks: Financial costs of removal and restoration
Potential for further legal action if not completed correctly

clauses.title: Consequences of Non-Compliance
clauses.originalText: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you.
clauses.simplifiedText: If you don't follow this notice, the city will destroy the structure, charge you for it, and start a criminal case against you.
clauses.explanation: This clause details the severe consequences of failing to comply with the notice, including demolition of the structure at the recipient's expense and potential criminal proceedings.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: This clause outlines the potential legal and financial repercussions of non-compliance, including demolition, financial penalties, and criminal charges.
risks: Financial burden of demolition costs and legal expenses

clauses.title: Final Intimation
clauses.originalText: This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action.
clauses.simplifiedText: This is the last warning before the court takes action.
clauses.explanation: This clause emphasizes the seriousness of the notice and indicates that it is the final warning before further legal action is taken.

rolePerspectives.interpretation: This clause underscores the urgency of the situation and the need for immediate action to avoid further legal consequences.

risks.description: Operating an illegal structure on public land without permission.
risks.recommendation: Immediately cease operations and seek legal counsel to understand the full extent of the violations and potential penalties.

risks.description: Failure to remove the illegal structure within the stipulated timeframe.
risks.recommendation: Prioritize the removal of the structure and restoration of the area to avoid further legal action and financial penalties. Document all actions taken for the compliance report.

risks.description: Incurring demolition costs and facing criminal proceedings due to non-compliance.
risks.recommendation: Take immediate action to comply with the notice and avoid the severe consequences of non-compliance. Seek legal representation to navigate the legal process.

actionPoints: Cease all operations at the unauthorized stall immediately.
Remove the entire illegal structure within 7 days of receiving the notice.
Restore the encroached area to its original condition.
Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik, within the specified timeframe.
Seek legal counsel to understand the full implications of the notice and ensure compliance.

citations.title: The Maharashtra Municipal Corporations Act, 1949
citations.description: This act governs the functioning of municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including regulations related to

originalContent:
Before the Hon’ble Court of Civil Judge, Nashik (Civil Jurisdiction) Court Notice No.: CJ/NK/ILG/2025/1784 Date of Issue:   17th October 2025 To, Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil Shop Owner (Unauthorized Stall) Plot No. 112/B, Near Shivaji Nagar Main Road, Ward No. 07, Nashik   –   422009, Maharashtra. Subject:   Legal Notice for Remova l of Unauthorized Commercial Structure and Encroachment on Public Street. Sir/Madam, Under the instructions and authority vested in me by   The Hon’ble Civil Court, Nashik , and in accordance with the provisions of   The Maha rashtra Municipal Corporations Act, 1949 , The Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014 , and other applicable municipal regulations, you are hereby served with this legal notice for   running and maintaining an ille gal shop/structure on public land without obtaining proper municipal permission . It has come to the notice of the   Nashik Municipal Corporation   and this Hon’ble Court that you have erected and are operating an unauthorized commercial stall under the name an d style   “Om Sai Snacks & Panipuri Center”   on   Main Road, Shivaji Nagar , causing   public inconvenience, obstruction to pedestrians, and violation of municipal norms . Further, multiple written complaints have been received from local residents, traffic authori ties, and shop owners in the area regarding your unlawful occupation of the public pathway. An inspection conducted by the   Municipal Encroachment Department   on 03.10.2025   confirmed the existence of the illegal structure. Despite prior warnings and verbal n otices issued on   08.10.2025   and   12.10.2025 , no corrective action has been taken by you. You are hereby directed as follows: 1.   Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public lan d   within   7 (seven) days   from the date of receipt of this notice. 2.   Restore the encroached area to its original condition   and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation. 3.   Submit a   written compliance report   to the   Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik , within the a bove - mentioned time period.

Failure to Comply: If you fail to comply with this notice within the stipulated period, the   Municipal Corporation shall proceed to remove/demolish the said illegal structure without any furthe r reference to you , and   all costs incurred   in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be   recovered from you as arrears of land revenue . Additionally,   criminal proceedings under Section 52 and 53 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 19 66 , and other applicable penal provisions, will be initiated against you. This notice is issued   under the direction of the Hon’ble Civil Judge, Nashik , and shall be treated as a   final intimation   before legal action. Issued By: (Signed) Adv. Meena R. Jadhav Standing Counsel, Nashik Municipal Corporation Enrollment No.: MAH/ADV/2020/4512 Chamber No. 12, Civil Court Complex, Nashik   –   422002 Contact: +91 - 98211 - 00089 | Email:   legalcell@nashikmc.gov.in

You have seven days to remove the stall, restore the area, and report to the city. Failure to comply will result in the city demolishing the structure at your expense. You will also face criminal charges and further legal action. visuals.textSummary: A legal notice issued by the Nashik Municipal Corporation to Mr. Ramesh Dattatray Patil for operating an unauthorized commercial stall on public land. The notice demands removal of the structure within 7 days, restoration of the area, and submission of a compliance report. Failure to comply will result in demolition, cost recovery, and potential criminal proceedings.

milestones.title: Inspection of Illegal Structure
milestones.description: Municipal Encroachment Department confirms the existence of the illegal structure.

milestones.title: Prior Warnings Issued
milestones.description: Verbal notices issued to Mr. Patil.

milestones.title: Second Warning Issued
milestones.description: Another verbal notice issued to Mr. Patil.

milestones.title: Notice Issue Date
milestones.description: Date of issue of the legal notice.

milestones.title: Deadline for Removal and Compliance
milestones.description: Mr. Patil must remove the illegal structure, restore the area, and submit a compliance report.
milestones.when: T+7 days after receipt of notice

responsibilities.label: Responsibilities for Removal of Unauthorized Structure

items.partyA: May remove/demolish the structure if not removed by Party B.
items.partyB: Must remove the illegal structure within 7 days of receiving the notice.
items.relatedClause: 1. Remove the entire illegal structure and vacate the public land within 7 (seven) days from the date of receipt of this notice.

items.partyA: May restore the area to its original condition if not restored by Party B.
items.partyB: Must restore the encroached area to its original condition.
items.relatedClause: 2. Restore the encroached area to its original condition and refrain from any future unauthorized occupation.

items.partyA: Receives and reviews the compliance report.
items.partyB: Must submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell within the stipulated time.
items.relatedClause: 3. Submit a written compliance report to the Municipal Legal Cell, Nashik, within the above-mentioned time period.

items.partyA: Recovers all costs incurred in the demolition from Party B.
items.partyB: Liable for all costs incurred in the demolition, including legal expenses.
items.relatedClause: all costs incurred in such demolition, including legal expenses, will be recovered from you as arrears of land revenue.
